Abnormal mitochondrial state has been implicated in the pathogenesis of various diseases including neurodegenerative disorders, myopathies, cardiovascular diseases, and cancers. Assessing mitochondrial functionality can be achieved by monitoring alterations in mitochondrial polarity and mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) integrity, which serve as valuable biomarkers.

Hydrogen sulfide (H2S), a gaseous signaling molecule, plays a regulatory role in mitochondrial respiratory chain activity, ATP synthesis, and calcium ion balance, thereby influencing cellular metabolism and signal transduction.
our study provides novel insights into the role of mitochondrial H2S in maintaining mitochondrial polarity and validates its protective effect on mtDNA through antioxidative mechanisms
